ideas.why: Catalyst is a rebound in oil prices as markets reprice geopolitical and supply risks. Exxon has direct leverage to higher crude prices via upstream earnings. Assumes supply tightens faster than new investment ramps.

Rising oil prices would lift cash flows for integrated majors. Chevron is exposed through upstream production and benefits if Venezuelan supply stays constrained. Assumes oil demand remains resilient.
Higher oil prices typically trigger increased upstream capex. Halliburton benefits from tighter supply driving investment in mature fields. Assumes operators respond to price signals with spending.
A sharp oil rebound could pressure BP due to its reduced upstream exposure and recent green energy write-downs. Assumes peers with higher oil leverage outperform in a rising crude tape.

key_assumptions: Geopolitical risk or Chinese stockpiling tightens oil markets within months
OPEC+ and non-OPEC supply does not offset demand surprises
Equity markets reprice energy exposure faster than broader risk assets
